answers.answer: You should take your cat to a vet if you possibly can.  This kind of condition is not uncommon and is likely an allergy - it can also be aggravated by anxiety, if your cat is the anxious type.The vet will probably prescribe a steroidal anti-inflammatory along with a skin cream.  There may or may not be a fungal infection involved, like ring worm.  If so, that is pretty easy to knock out, but with the rest of the symptoms, you really need a vet's diagnosis and prescription.Good luck!  Let us know what happens.

Also, in addition to the above, you should get a thyroid test done and get the kidneys checked.  These conditions can manifest as skin problems.  When a cat is 7 yrs and up, you should keep an eye on those conditions, as well as diabetes.Good luck to ya!!
